snippet: A new plan for American armed forces, driven by $450 billion in cuts, adds attention to threats in Asia but continues a strong presence in the Middle East.
abstract: News analysis of new military strategy announced by President Obama, which puts his own stamp on an all-encompassing policy by turning from the grinding ground wars he inherited from the Bush administration and refocusing on what he describes as a smaller, more agile force in Asia, the Pacific and the Middle East.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and THOM SHANKER

lead_paragraph: A new plan for American armed forces, driven by $450 billion in cuts, adds attention to threats in Asia but continues a strong presence in the Middle East.

headline.seo: President Obama Puts His Stamp on Defense Strategy
headline.main: Obama Puts His Stamp on Strategy for a Leaner Military
headline.print_headline: A Strategy for a Leaner Military, With Obama Taking the Lead

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
